hotspots.label: Large Bulging Eyes
hotspots.fact: Toads have excellent vision and can see in many directions without moving their heads. Their large eyes help them spot insects and other prey from far away.

hotspots.label: Bumpy, Warty Skin
hotspots.fact: These bumps on a toad's skin contain special glands that produce toxins to protect them from predators. The bumpy texture also helps toads blend in with dirt and rocks.

hotspots.label: Insects on Twig
hotspots.fact: Toads are carnivores that eat insects like flies, beetles, and mosquitoes. They use their sticky tongues to catch and eat insects in just a fraction of a second!

hotspots.label: Short, Sturdy Legs
hotspots.fact: Toad legs are built for hopping and walking on land, unlike frogs which are better jumpers. Toads move slower but can travel long distances looking for food and water.
